page.title: 10 Beck Row Primary School
page.content: The School,which was built in 1888,was an all age school with 4 rooms,one of which was large and served as a hall. In1956 2 more rooms were added with toilets to replace the original rather primitive toilet block. A Canteen and Kitchen were added to provide hot meals during the 1939-45 War. The age range of children changed when Secondary children went to Mildenhall Riverside School.The school now caters for 120, 5 to 9 year old children.There are 5 full-time teachers,1 part-time teacher,1 classroom ancillary,1 cook, 1 assistant cook and one cleaner-in charge.The school serves a large area from Holywell Row to Shippea Hill. The building is very similar to St.John's Church {photographs} and is sometimes mistaken for a Church by strangers who call to enquire about times of Services.
